Description: Shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery dinos or column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: on shoulder, alternating red and black tongue frieze; below, black-figure frieze with part of chariot to right preserved (hoplite in car, back and legs missing; red on helmet and crest, red on shield, added white on chiton); he, not any second figure, holds reins and goad; parts of chariot and further object top right preserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 274, no. B223)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 40, pl. XX, no. 19)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1200)
